alert.note: Alert for Clark (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 09 at 4:18PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL CLARK...OLDHAM...SHELBY... NORTHEASTERN NELSON...ANDERSON...HENRY...NORTHEASTERN JEFFERSON... FRANKLIN...SPENCER...NORTHWESTERN MERCER...WOODFORD...SOUTHWESTERN SCOTT...SOUTHERN TRIMBLE...NORTHEASTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EST... At 418 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers along a line extending from near Glenview to 12 miles north of Springfield. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. Isolated lightning strikes possible. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Louisville, Lexington, Frankfort, Jeffersonville, Jeffersontown, St. Matthews, Shelbyville, Lyndon, Lawrenceburg, and Versailles. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville.
